topic.title: Staying Safe on ZeroNet
topic.body: I've been using ZeroNet about a month or so. As a newb, what are the best practices to keep away from all the weird and illegal ZeroNet sites? As I understand it, simply visiting a site will download that site's content to your computer, so I would rather not click any links unknowingly and have that shit automatically save to my computer.

topic.title: ZeroNet Large File Zite?
topic.body: I'd like to start a zite that hosts videos and texts that the big-tech fact-checkers have censored. Is ZeroNet tailored for this?

1611308558_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
> [qzm](#comment_13_1HyrFrFXUHZC58qLuFrjAXm2Jjkb3Y6ufX): I used to be that way. I wanted to live and let live with everyone, and pretty well leave everyone alone.Now I think that the vast majority of people are just automatons with no will of their own. If it was up to me, I would train up a contingent of ideologically similar, thoughtful, educated, caretakers. We will then exterminate almost all adults over the age of 15 And at that point we would start from scratch. If after a couple of generations people are just still fucked like they are now then I say we nuke the entire thing, And ensure that the earth remains a toxic radiated barren hellscape for at least 1 million years.

Bill Gates, is that you?

1599651874_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
> [jager](#comment_49_1MCNYstff4yDsoNktn2MzGbtsCHqnRxHWX): Good. Don't talk about Zeronet. Back in the day we didn't have a cultural divide. Part of the reason for that was because people generally paid for news straight up. Now, news makes revenue through clicks and advertising that is optimized for hate fuel. [...]

Agreed, great point. As a user of the early net, and even BBSs, ZeroNet reminds me very much of those times. Now that every idiot can get online without so much as having to even connect a cable, it's become a less free place. Where there once was constructive discussion, there is now childish bickering. And all these idiots are now pushing for 'Net Neutrality'. Yeah, I'm sure it will be 'neutral' alright! Goes to show how morons destroy freedom anywhere they go.

1611606727_1LPWdVJ1GNU738u2VUkoZdw9B7u4V.body:
> [crayola](#comment_2_1LPWdVJ1GNU738u2VUkoZdw9B7u4VPmfNZ): that is true, and thats why we need to keep it alive. promote it as much as you can and its bound to grow

I was thinking about having some stickers printed up: 'ZeroNet.io: Join the Free Speech Internet', or something along those lines.

1611726067_13tGzarcdadLitoZsqPPW8WHypGtd.body: I'd say the block-button for now. If the platform ever takes off, perhaps moderated zites with user logins.

1611635380_14S5V96JR2e3vNSa6L9LiJMXoSGRb.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_2929_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Check out Twitter's Project Bluesky.

I'd rather not.

1610813974_1Jiwv87WRUY6BjRv7Lt5gocur6nfh.body:
> [volkon](#comment_4_1DWYNPAmxeKc5Brcs1Yi6oyjndj53kPeLP): With all due respect, fuck GAB. It is still censored in some aspects. Let's bring people to Zeronet. I am going to donate bitcoin to new users and current users at random.

Anything centralized is a target of the censors at this point. Problem is, since they will have a hard time censoring ZeroNet, they'll probably immediately begin the political arrests on false charges.

1611787253_139pHaxesZa11czwptXVY62ZrNWUh.body:
> [biznizman](#comment_6_1BWgyS5ThxyuzEWWj2dats3sgQBppYkXne): USE TOR! ALWAYS AND WITHOUT EXCEPTION! [...]

Thanks. I've enabled Tor through the option within ZeroNet, but is it still recommended to use the Tor browser to view ZeroNet? There doesn't seem to be an option any longer for "No proxy for" within Tor browser.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/faq/#how-to-use-zeronet-in-tor-browser

1612626557_1FwNEGpdNnQE4H83JHLKWLk56H7xw.body:
> [seidoken](#comment_9_1Pxg9q2iUdQkbwgT459ArjQ12mpXN8cyEB): Most spammers get added to the main blocklist, if you are connected to that you shouldn't receive anything from them I would think.

How can I find/apply these blocklists to my account? Do they include blocklists for shady zites as well?

> [seidoken](#comment_10_1Pxg9q2iUdQkbwgT459ArjQ12mpXN8cyEB): Here is the link to the Mother of all Blocklist site. http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LgqZfbtr6dukbjHdjWBEmmthq1shEv3y1/Just connecting to the site will link it and you can select what it blocks. Individual zites might have their own blocklists that you can connect too. I know 08chan has one. In zerohello if you are connected to zerotalk or other zites you can type blocklist into the search bar and look for any links.

Thank you, sir.

1613138654_1BkheWe7wwX2r3HuRQunHFu9jTMtC.body:
These are all great ideas, though I think I've come to the same conclusion as another user on a similar post here:

ZeroNet being 'underground' and not used by the masses is probably a good thing. The learning, and psychological (as you mentioned) curves keep out the riff-raff and basic idiots. Conversations here see to be much more intelligent.

1629402955_19BXHBD1GfYpSpvdHsuHJsJ97mYpx.body:
> [hermetris](#comment_4_12stz6mJvqkxMd5EFrPB2RWa5WnEg1mo9X): Oh man! You seem to have it good. I am in Germany ... and these stupid people (unfortunately you can't call it anything else) are really cruel!

How about 'Schweinhunde'?
